intro: Craniolaria integrifolia, commonly known as the smooth-leafed craniolaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Scrophulariaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves that are typically smooth and glossy. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. It is native to parts of southern Africa and thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly found in natural habitats.
